ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the geologic history of greece
I learned very niche tectonics in a specific area.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strengths: learned a lot from the other student's presentations. field trip to greece. weaknesses: literally zero grades or feedback were given before the end of the semester which is stressful and makes it difficult to know if you have a grasp on the concepts
I thought it was done well

It would be better to have a broad subfield coverage of the area of study rather than exclusively niche tectonics. I would have enjoyed diving into the oceanography, paleontology, and culture of the area much more. That way, when going on the field trip it would be a wholistic appreciation of the area.

strengths: varied topics covered, trip to Greece
weaknesses: lack of focus during class

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: the structure of this class varies depending on who is teaching it, but definitely take it if you want an almost free field trip
Yes, if you want to do a departmental field trip.
Probably not this same version. Maybe a different version of the field trip course.
If you want to go on the department trip!
Yes, it was so much to take the course and learn about Greece and areas that we will be going in the field trip!
Yes, if you are in the EPS department go on the field trip!
